metadata.title: Market Power in Agricultural Land Markets: Concepts and Empirical Challenges

data_sources.description: The study uses land sales transaction data from local committees of land valuation experts in Brandenburg, Germany, covering the years 2007 to 2018. This dataset includes transaction prices, lot sizes, soil quality, type of land use (arable land or grassland), and anonymized information about buyer and seller types. The data is used to analyze the relationship between land use concentration and farmland prices, revealing a negative relationship that suggests market power on the buyer side.
data_sources.access_conditions: Data is available from local committees of land valuation experts, but access may be restricted due to privacy concerns.

assessment.findability_reason: The data is mentioned in the publication but specific access details or identifiers are not provided.
assessment.accessibility_reason: Access to the data is restricted and may require permissions from local authorities.
assessment.interoperability_reason: The data format and standards are not specified, limiting interoperability.
assessment.reusability_reason: Reusability is limited due to restricted access and unspecified data license.
